article.headline: Bradley 64, Loyola of Chicago 47
article.story: CHICAGO (AP) -- Jeremy Crouch scored 21 points as Bradley beat Loyola of Chicago 64-47 Wednesday night. Crouch's tally included five 3-pointers and two steals for the Braves (5-2), who have won five of six. Daniel Ruffin had 10 points and six assists, and Theron Wilson added nine points and eight rebounds in front of a large pro-Bradley crowd. J.R. Blount had 18 points on 8-of-15 shooting for the Ramblers (2-5), who dropped their third straight. Leon Young had 10 points and eight rebounds, and Tracy Robinson added nine points. Bradley went up 46-40 after a 20-4 run, capped by a steal and layup from Crouch with 7:33 remaining. The Braves finished the game on an 18-7 run that included a buzzer-beating 3 by Andrew Warren. Crouch hit a 3-pointer with 1:11 left in the first half to pull the Braves to within four. Leon Young split a pair of free throws to give Loyola a 29-24 halftime lead. Bradley shot 63.6 percent in the second half after shooting 33.3 percent in the first half. Conversely, Loyola hit 52.2 percent of their first-half shots but sank only 35 percent in the second half.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
